ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the history of the discipline of comparative literature and several major schools of literary theories.
comprehensive overview of comparative literature as a field; its evolutionary history;
An understanding of comparative literatures and a good knowledge of related theoretical discourses
This is a great survey for both those with ample and little background in Comp Lit - most of all it's a great setting and preparation for future academic debates.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The content is well organized and the instructor's response to students is prompt and helpful.
more interdisciplinary materials could be included; e.g. how sociology, anthropology, or theology might serve methodologically for complit;
The course is good in informing Phd students beginning their career of the corpus. It tells you what's out there.

The course had a great balance between lecturing parts and discussions, not so obvious given the size of our group! The reading materials were very interesting and stimulated a fascinating debate almost every week.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I think this class is a crucial entry-level class for the graduate student in literature to have a general view of this discipline.
Absolutely! This is best littheory course I've taken.
Yes I would recommend this course. It is something that literature students should know. And the course is well-organized.
